topic.title: Creating and connecting to a Microsoft SQL Server service

body.p: This document describes how to create a Microsoft SQL Server 2012 or 2014 service, and provide connectivity to it using the Helion client's tunnel command.
body.note: This document will demonstrate how to create and connect to a Microsoft SQL Server 2012 instance; the procedure for creating and connecting to a Microsoft SQL Server 2014 service is the same.
body.p: This document contains the following sections:

li.xref: Create a Microsoft SQL Server service instance

ul.li: A Helion Openstack installation or a Helion Public Cloud account

An ALS 1.3 (or later) cluster with an instance of SQL Server added. This cluster and service is created using the ALS cluster management tool (cf-mgmt) with the following commands:
create-cluster
add-service You must use the 1.3 version (or later) of the ALS cluster management tool for this tutorial.

section.title: Create a Microsoft SQL Server service instance
section.note: If you have already created a Microsoft SQL Server instance, you don't need to create another.

section.p: Once the tunneling application is deployed and bound to the service, you can connect to the service using SQL Server Management Studio.
